meaningMnemonic: The kanji itself means <kanji>temporary</kanji>. When you add the に, we're asking you to imagine a situation temporarily, so the meaning changes to <vocabulary>supposing</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>if</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
The reading is kun'yomi, so here's a mnemonic to remember it: 

<vocabulary>If</vocabulary> you don't mind, could you <reading>carry</reading> (かり) this for me? <vocabulary>Supposing</vocabulary> it's not too much trouble, of course.
